issue.subject: WPS for SHOP : remote user identification
issue.description:
The identification of remote users for accessing the SHOP WPS is today a unique couple login/password + the joomla user login.

For more security, it would be better to use the *guid* (known as "code" in PARTNER administration) instead of the joomla user login.

journals.notes:
I suggest to keep this in mind and try to integrate it for V3.
Any input ?

In easySDI V4, SHOP WPS will be replaced by a SHOP REST service.
Such service will authenticate requester with http basic authentication. Login will be stored in easySDI and attached to each organism. Such REST service will be secured with SSL/TLS encryption.
this ticket should be updated with the last "state" of the WPS (what was finally done for V4.0.0 release).

Hi Xavier,

As this feature is available in easySDI V4, I suggest to close it.
I guess that WPS technical description has a better place inside Wiki than this ticket. Part of the global documentation to write about easySDI...

You are right for the doc.

My question was more : what is the delta (if there is one) beetween the first description of the ticket (use of GUID, WPS in REST,...) and the delivered WPS.

Hi Xavier,

I will resume what is implemented in this new PHP WPS service.

* the PHP WPS service replaces totally the WPS Java servlet
* the WPS service asks always an HTTP basic authentication for any call (it's important to secure this service with SSL)
* the SHOP options allows Administrator to define which easySDI account is used for a global authentication on WPS service (managing all requests of all organisms)
* the Administrator is able to define, inside the "extraction" tab, the authentication login for each organism (managing all requests of this organism)

I hope it is clearer :-)
